intro: Taraxacum faucicola, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces a distinctive yellow flower that blooms in spring, followed by a fluffy seed head that disperses via the wind. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, sunny areas. Taraxacum faucicola is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
